Recap: Dinah follows Mallet to Towers after she finds a motel key in his jacket. He talks with Regina again and she tells him that she still would like to have him. He tells her that he is engaged, as Dinah watches Regina hold Mallet's hand and listens to their conversation. Finally, Mallet lets Dinah know he knows she followed him, they have a small fight and both think the other might be getting cold feet about the marriage.

Marina attempts to spy on Alan-Michael and ends up sleeping with him. He asks her if this means she will accept what he must do to get Spaulding Enterprises back and she tells him no. Gus tells Buzz he has been clean and sober for 5 days. Lizzie tells Ava that Coop still loves the baby and Coop tells Ava that he does still care and is confused. Lizzie vows to get Coop back. Jonathan tells Reva what he did at the wedding and she tries to convince him that baby needs him. Jonathan asks her if she is afraid to die and that he doesn't want to lose her and Tammy, too. She tells him that she will stick around for a while for he needs her just like that baby needs him.
Transcript: Mallet: Hey! Hello, hello, gorgeous girlfriend.
Dinah: Hello, beautiful fiancé.
Mallet: Fiancé. Right. These are for you.
Dinah: Sweetie, these are beautiful. You feeling guilty about something?
Mallet: Mmm, yeah, actually I'm feeling guilty for spending money on these when you don't appreciate them. Okay, okay. Why don't we call them "Thank you for saying yes when I proposed" flowers?
Dinah: Sweetie, there was never any doubt. Thank you, they're beautiful.
Mallet: You're welcome. ( Knock on door )
Dinah: Oh, you know what, let me get that and put these in water.
Mallet: Okay.
Dinah: Okay? They're gorgeous. Thank you.
Marina: Hey, Dinah. I know I'm early, but I really have to talk to you about my plan to nail Alan-Michael.
Dinah: Okay.
Marina: I know that you're not...
Dinah: Everybody asks me who does my nails. Okay, I'll give you the number.
Mallet: Oh, hey.
Marina: Oh! Hi, Mallet. Flowers.
Mallet: Yeah, flowers.
Dinah: Aren't they beautiful?
Mallet: And, uh... speaking of grooming, I guess I'll... I'll go manscape?
Dinah: ( Laughs ) He's sexy.
Marina: Sorry about that. I didn't know he was here.
Dinah: It's okay. What were you saying about Alan-Michael?
Marina: You know, um, right now is probably not a good time. So, uh, why don't you give me a call on my cell? Do you have a pen?
Dinah: Yeah, um... I think I have a pen. Somewhere around here. Honey, do we have pens anymore, in this room?
Mallet: Uh, yeah, look in my jacket.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gus: Hey, Harley, it's me. Just wanted you to know I'm on the straight and narrow, and uh, was wondering if you're going to come home.
Operator: Sir? Are you there? Do you wish to place your long distance call?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: Coming up here to watch the sunrise was a great idea.
Coop: Yeah?
Ava: Yeah. Of course, it was three hours ago...
Coop: Hey. Are you saying you're getting sick of me already?
Ava: Are you kidding? I was sick of you a long time ago.
Coop: What?
Ava: ( Laughs )
Coop: Please.
Ava: No, never. Why, are you getting sick of me already?
Coop: Well, I was going to tell you, but...
Ava: Hmm?
Coop: No. Never.
Ava: Good.
Coop: Good, good, good. So, I guess we should go, then?
Ava: I guess so.
Coop: Okay, after you. Hmm.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Reva: "I had an early meeting. You were sleeping so soundly I didn't want to wake you. Love you, Josh." Yeah, well, I was sleeping so soundly because that's the only thing I can do these days. "Ten things I want to do before I die."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Buzz: Lizzie?
Lizzie: Hey, that's from the nursery. Where are you going with it?
Buzz: Uh... Coop wanted me to get rid of it.
Lizzie: He's emptying out the nursery? Why? Oh. To make room for Ava.
Buzz: Do you want to torture yourself?
Lizzie: No, I don't, I just...
Buzz: Then go home.
Lizzie: This is all your fault!
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: I think the most important thing here is that we protect Harley from Alan-Michael, and if we work together, I really believe that we can do that, Dinah. Dinah?
Dinah: No. No. Marina, you can't do this, because it's going to be too tempting for you. And you're only going to get hurt.
Marina: Hurt? Please, I'm a cop.
Dinah: You're also a woman.
Marina: Dinah, I don't think you're getting this. I am so totally over the guy.
Dinah: Completely?

Marina: Yes. Completely. Totally. 100% totally and completely over Alan- Michael Spaulding. I wouldn't be with him if he were the last man on earth. But he is crazy about me , and I think that I can use that to get us the information we need about Harley.
Dinah: All right, so hypothetically, you're telling me it won't freak you out in the least if in some way, you have to kiss Alan-Michael to get information from him.
Marina: It's just part of the job.

Dinah: You hope. Marina, look, um... I don't think that this is a good idea. I think it's real bad to-- you know, put your hopes into somebody and play with their feelings in that way. Even if somebody has done some bad stuff in their life, his or her life, they have flaws. They have major flaws. And it's not fair for you to get their hopes up that high.
Marina: And since when are you Alan-Michael's best friend?

Dinah: I'm not. I'm just saying I think you and I have to find a way to neutralize this whole thing, okay? And so give me a day to think about a different plan, a different approach. And in the meantime, I want you to stay away from this guy, all right? Because I don't think you're over him as much as you think you are.
Mallet: Dinah? Hey. Is everything all right with Marina?
Dinah: Fine.
Mallet: All right. I've to get going.
Dinah: Where?
Mallet: I'm going to run some errands and then I'm going to go to work, and... I love you. And I'll see you later.
Dinah: I love you, too. Bye. Oh, yeah, he's guilty.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Reva: "Ten things I want to do before I die. Buy myself a fur coat. And one for mama. Visit the French Riviera. Ride in a race car. Go surfing in Australia." Where in the world did I get that? I certainly didn't think small, did I? "Marry Joshua. Just let me marry Joshua, lord. Let me marry him and have his kids and be a grandma to their kids, and I swear I can die happy."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: This is all your fault!
Jonathan: Ow, what the hell? Knock it off!

Lizzie: It's all your fault! Why?! Why did you come to my wedding and open your big fat mouth? You took Coop from me and you just handed him right to Ava. You just pushed him right into her long freaking arms! Coop. Hey, you look great. Coop!
Jonathan: ( Laughs ) Hey, that went really well. That went good.
Lizzie: You see that door? That's your future, too, because Tammy's never going to take you back. Are you glad that you did the right thing now? You ruined my life, Jonathan.
Jonathan: Oh, would you stop with the drama queen crap and start showing me some respect. I am the father of your kid.
Lizzie: Only by a cruel act of nature.
Jonathan: Yeah? You liked it, babe. Takes two, doesn't it. And don't lay this "Coop dumped me" crap on me either, because you need to just start thinking about what you're going to do to fix it.
Lizzie: I don't suppose you have any ideas?
Jonathan: Whoa. How to ice Legs McGee? No, I, uh... I don't have a clue. I have my own stuff to deal with, but I'm sure with your imagination, you'll be fine.
Gus: Hey, Lizzie, how's the baby?
Lizzie: Drop dead.
Gus: Okay. Well, rumor has it I missed quite a wedding. Kind of like the first time I tried to marry your daughter.
Buzz: Actually, there were a lot of similarities. ( Beeping ) Oops, that's the oven.
Melinda: I'll get it, Buzz, don't worry.
Buzz: Oh, thank you, Melinda.
Gus: So are you okay?
Coop: Sure, yeah. Lizzie's out of my life for good, and today, dad and I started clearing out the nursery and turning it back into a bedroom, so...
Buzz: Actually, I already started.
Ava: Oh, you're cleaning it out?
Coop: So you can move back in. If you want to.
Ava: If I want to.
Coop: So, is that a yes?
Ava: That's a big yes!
Coop: That's a yes?
Ava: I'd love to move back in, are you kidding me?
Gus: Aw, that's sweet. Want me to help you move?
Buzz: No, no, we're fine.
Gus: I don't mind, I'm actually here because I'm looking for a little family.
Buzz: Look, stay here, I don't need any help.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: Come on, how long does it take you to come out and get a package? Really? Yeah...
Alan-Michael: Marina.
Marina: Oh. Hi. Uh, can I call you back? Yeah, thanks. Hey. I was, uh, just visiting a friend. I didn't expect to run into you, so... take care.
Alan-Michael: Well, hold on. I was... the desk called up, there's a package for me downstairs, but it can wait. How would you feel about visiting another friend?
Marina: You mean you?
Alan-Michael: All I'm talking about is a cup of coffee, Marina. So we can catch up.
Marina: Okay. I suppose a cup of coffee couldn't hurt.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Regina: I know that it's kind of wimpy to admit this, but, uh... I was scared.
Mallet: That's okay. But you don't have to be scared anymore. Because he's back in prison, and we can go back to living our lives. And I guess you, uh, you don't need a bodyguard anymore.
Regina: You can guard my body anytime you like, A.C.
Mallet: Regina...
Regina: Come on, we were good together once. We could be again, so I was thinking maybe I shouldn't go back home. Maybe I should stick around Springfield.
[SCENE_BREAK]
( Knock on door ) ( knock on door )
Reva: Hi.
Jonathan: What the hell are you doing? I called the hospital, they said you checked yourself out.
Reva: Uh, I...
Jonathan: You lied to me.
Reva: Lied? What?
Jonathan: About being sick?
Reva: I... I was. Am. I am.

Jonathan: No, no no. You made it seem like you weren't going to make it? Like if you were going to die, your dying wish was that you wanted me to get you your grandchild? So I go over to Coop and Lizzie's wedding, bust in, stop the thing, say, "Hey everybody, that's not his baby, it's mine!" And look where it got me.
Reva: You stopped the wedding? You told the truth?
Jonathan: Yeah, yeah. You missed a good time.
Reva: ( Laughs ) Oh, Jonathan! I... I am so proud of you!
Jonathan: Would you get off of me? You ruined everything! Tammy won't even speak to me now. She probably broke up with me for good.
Reva: No, no, no, honey. It'll be fine. She'll be fine. You'll work it out. Because she loves you. And when you love somebody enough, you can forgive them almost anything.
Jonathan: Even a secret this big?
Reva: Well, yeah, because you didn't do it to hurt her, you did it to protect what you have. She'll understand.
Jonathan: You think?
Reva: I know.

Jonathan: Yeah, I know you know. Because it's exactly what you're doing with Josh. You're protecting him from the fact that you have cancer, right? Well, guess what, Mom? I fessed up. Now it's your turn. Either you tell Josh that you're sick, or I will.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Kim Zimmer, "Inside The Light." Larry and I spent a lot of time laughing together. Larry was a teacher. Larry told the best Hollywood stories I've ever heard. I have so many Larry Gates stories that just make me giggle inside and when we lost him, it was... it was a huge loss to the show. And I think about Larry... every day. See Reva, Wednesday, June 28, "Inside The Light."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: What kind of person threatens a cancer patient?
Jonathan: No, no. I told the truth, now it's your turn. "Be a man, Jonathan," she says. "Take responsibility for your kid." Good advice, Reva. Thanks for nothing.
Reva: I didn't say it was going to be easy.
Jonathan: Oh, yeah, you get to keep as many secrets as you want. I have to tell the truth and take the hit.
Reva: You told the truth because you knew it was the right thing.

Jonathan: I wish you could have seen the look on Tammy's face. I slept with her friend. I got her friend pregnant. I might as well have taken a knife and stabbed it in her guts. On top of all that, I might be chained to psycho Lizzie Spaulding for the rest of my life.
Reva: Honey, it's not a chain. It's a baby. It is a baby who won't feel abandoned now, the way you felt that I abandoned you.
Jonathan: Wow. I don't know why I ever listen to you.
Reva: No, really, Jonathan, you spent so much of your young life lashing out and destroying things. But now you've created something. Something perfect and precious, another life.
Jonathan: Oh, my God. Who are you?
Reva: No, sweetie... this baby is the greatest gift ever. So you have to stop complaining, and you have to start being grateful. Because you're going to be a daddy, whether you like it or not.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Coop: Whoa, whoa! Gus, please, careful, okay?
Gus: All right.
Coop: You know what, I'll take care of it, thanks.
Gus: There's not a baby in it. Take it easy.
Coop: Thankfully.
Buzz: No, I got it.
Gus: Oh, make me feel stupid, why don't you?
Regan: Regan Marshall, Detective, from Internal Affairs.
Gus: Oh, hi. Right. So you're here to check up on me?
Regan: You can say that.
Gus: Uh-huh. Are you hungry? You want a coffee or a Danish or something like that? Because my father-in-law really runs a great place here.
Regan: No, thank you.

Gus: Um... Ms. Marshall, I'm good, I'm good. I'm clean and sober, and I'm towing the line, and I'm running a clean ship. And I'm just trying to stay busy right now. Actually, I'm doing something for my father-in-law. I'm helping them move. And if I wasn't okay, he wouldn't let me even step foot in this place, so I'm good.
Regan: Okay. I'll head over to headquarters and file my report.
Gus: That's it?
Regan: For now. Good luck to you, Detective. Hang in there.
Gus: Yeah.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: I guess I owe you an apology for what you heard me say before.
Ava: Yeah. That I have long arms. I kind of think that's the least that you need to apologize to me about.
Lizzie: Look, Ava, I don't want to fight with you, okay? I mean it. I just want to find a way for you and me and Coop to just get along.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Mallet: It's like I told you the other day. I... I'm engaged.
Regina: Well, you were married before, and that didn't make a difference.
Mallet: Oh man, oh man. Thanks for reminding me.
Regina: Was it so awful?
Mallet: Yeah, it was not... it was not good. It was not good. All right, and don't tell me that you'd like to do that again. That you'd settle for being "the other woman" again.
Regina: I didn't settle at all. I mean, I got exactly what I wanted. You.
Mallet: Yeah, you know what, and I got a divorce, which is not what I wanted.
Regina: Are you sure about that? Why'd you cheat on Harley then? If you really loved her, then...

Mallet: Because I loved her. Because I loved her. I loved Harley deeply. I loved her desperately. And I didn't think I deserved her, so you know what? I found a way to screw that up. And I lived with that mistake for years, wishing and wanting to take it back. And now, by the grace of God, I've been given another chance, another chance with a really amazing woman.
Regina: Does that mean no?
Mallet: Yeah. Yeah, it does.
Waiter: From the gentleman.
Dinah: Gentleman? What gentleman?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: Milk, yeah?
Marina: Yeah.
Alan-Michael: Qu'est-ce que c'est passe apres le marriage chez Cooper? I mean, what's the wedding fallout? Buzz going to put out a contract on my niece?
Marina: You know, we hadn't thought of that, but it's not a bad idea.
Alan-Michael: On the other hand, there is cause for rejoicing. I mean, now another Cooper won't be bound for life with another spoiled, superior Spaulding.
Marina: Oh, gee, I don't know anyone like that.
Alan-Michael: I imagine Buzz and Frank haven't been this happy since you and I self destructed.
Marina: We did not self destruct, Alan-Michael. That was all you. Oh, unless you expected me to thank you for repeatedly lying to me.
Alan-Michael: I never lied about how I felt about you, Marina.
Marina: Oh, whatever.

Alan-Michael: Whatever? I would think that would matter to you a lot. Yes, I wanted you and the company at the same time. But I don't think either wish is unreasonable. Nor are they mutually exclusive. I still don't think that. But I should have had the guts to be up front with you about it. I tried to tell you a couple of times, but I was afraid of losing you. ( Cell phone rings )
Marina: You should probably get that. It's probably business, you know, someone to help you sink my Aunt Harley.
Alan-Michael: Excuse me. Yeah, oh... what are you doing?
Marina: You caught me.
Alan-Michael: I see that. At what, though?
Marina: I... I was just looking for a piece of gum or a mint or something, so that I could do this.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Mallet: Honey! This is a nice surprise. I was just telling my friend here, Regina, all about you. Regina, this is my fiancé, Dinah Marler. Dinah, this is Regina Morrison. We worked together on the force down in Florida.
Dinah: Oh, really?
Mallet: Mm-hmm.
Dinah: Oh, good.

Mallet: And Regina got back in touch with me, because remember the notes, the weird threatening notes? Well, Regina got them too, and it turns out it was from some guy that we'd put away a long time ago that still had it in for us.
Dinah: Oh, well, I was right.
Mallet: You were right. I was the target, not you. So... now the guy's back in prison, case closed, problem solved, and um... I guess you'll be heading home now, right, Regina?
Regina: But first I want to tell you something, Dinah. Congratulations on your engagement. I mean, you've got yourself quite a guy here, and he's obviously crazy about you. So take care.
Mallet: You, too. Take care.
Dinah: Nice meeting you.
Mallet: Honey? Would you like to sit down and wipe that egg off your face and finish your mimosa?
Dinah: Well, what gave you the idea that I was following you?
Mallet: Uh, I'm a cop and I can spot a tail?
Dinah: Oh, yes, you can. You can hold a hand real good, too. So I wouldn't have followed you if you had told me where you were going. So why didn't you tell me where you were going?
Mallet: Because I know you, and I know you get jealous when there's no reason to be.
Dinah: Unless that's what you wanted.
Mallet: What? Why would I want you to be jealous?
Dinah: I don't know, Mallet. Maybe you're getting cold feet about this wedding. And you're just not saying it. Well? Do you deny it?

Mallet: Yeah, I do deny it. You know what's really interesting about all of this? The fact that your mind went to a place like that tells me that uh... maybe you're the one who's having the misgivings.
Dinah: Why would you even think I would be capable of thinking that?
Mallet: Why would you think that about me?
Dinah: Because you're the one who lied, Mallet.
Mallet: You followed me.
Dinah: Because you lied.
Mallet: Oh, man. Are we having a fight?
Dinah: I'm not sure, are we?
Mallet: Yeah, I think this is a fight, I think it qualifies as a fight. Well, is it over now? Because if it is a fight and it's over now, then maybe we can make up.
Dinah: And have sex? Because your mind is one-track, always? S-E-X.
Mallet: Oh, honey. Like yours isn't.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: It feels like we've never been apart, doesn't it? Marina?
Marina: Yeah?

Alan-Michael: You know you're the real reason I came back to Springfield, don't you? I mean, getting the company, that's a perk, but... you. You're what I really wanted. Does this mean you're going to support what I'm trying to do?
Marina: I didn't say that.
Alan-Michael: Okay. But you're not going to let it come between us, are you? Again? Otherwise you wouldn't be here right now.
Marina: Would you look at the time? I've got to go.
Alan-Michael: Now?
Marina: Yeah, um... I really have to get out of here.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: How are you going to tell me about honesty and family when you're lying about being sick?
Reva: I'm not lying to Joshua; I'm sparing him.
Jonathan: Oh, yeah, right. I want to be there when he finds out, so I can watch his head explode.
Reva: When are you going to get it through that thick head of yours that I'm doing this to protect Josh? And you.
Jonathan: Reva knows best, huh?
Reva: I'm sorry you're mad. I am. But this is going to work out. And I'm going to tell Josh when the time is right.
Jonathan: Oh. I hope I get tickets to that show. Who's your next victim, Reva? You've pushed Josh away. You've ruined my freaking life with Tammy. Who's next on the fix-it list?
Reva: I know it's going to work out.
Jonathan: You think you know everything.
Reva: Hey!
Jonathan: Like telling me to claim Lizzie's baby.
Reva: Your baby! Just tell me exactly what Tammy said when she found out.
Jonathan: Not much. She was pretty freaked out and pretty mad. And I thought I had a chance when Cassie told me I could talk to her, but... I don't know.
Reva: She does know that you only slept with Lizzie after she broke up with you, right?

Jonathan: No. I forgot to tell her that. Of course she knows that, Reva! She's not even that freaked out about the fact that I slept with Lizzie. What really upset her is the whole lie about the baby. Now no matter what happens between us, things are always going to be different.
Reva: It'll work out.

Jonathan: No. Not with this baby hanging around always over my head. Because now if the baby comes out and I turn my back on it, and I ignore it, Tammy is going to think I'm some kind of creep. Or, if the baby comes out, and I play dada and coo to it and feed it a bottle and take it to the park, Tammy's...
Reva: You might like it.
Jonathan: No. I don't want this baby in Tammy's face. Every time she looks at it, she's going to love me less and less.
Reva: She may love you more, because it's part of you, Jonathan.
Jonathan: Reva, you've got to back off. I did something for you; now you do something for me. Shut up about Lizzie's baby.
Reva: Your baby!

Jonathan: Fine! I admitted it's my baby! That is all I am going to do! If, by some miracle, Tammy takes me back, she will be my priority from now on, Reva. She is what I care about, not some baby that I didn't even want in the first place.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ava: There is no three of us. There's me and Coop. And then there's you. And then there's you flying around in the radar up here somewhere, not being detected.
Lizzie: Wow, somebody's pretty sure of herself.
Ava: Wow, somebody's really delusional thinking Coop wants anything to do with her.
Lizzie: No, Ava. I know the score. I know that Coop is over me. For the moment. But the baby? There's no way he's over her.
Ava: Oh, Jonathan's baby? The baby you've been lying to Coop about for months?
Lizzie: Lie or no lie, Coop still loves this baby.
Ava: He thought she was his.
Lizzie: That's how it started. But once a love like that starts, I mean, you can't just turn it off. Especially not for someone like Coop, who feels things so deeply.
Ava: You actually believe what you're saying?

Lizzie: Listen to me. Coop is hurt, okay? So of course he's going to deny how he's really feeling, but pretty soon he is going to start to question his choice. Not just about the baby, but about you, too. Actually, you'll probably start to question him as well.
Ava: Yeah? How do you figure?
Lizzie: Come on, Ava. He left you for me. Didn't he? That's got to hurt.
Ava: It was out of obligation, not because he loved you, babe.
Lizzie: Still, part of you has to be angry at him. And you have to be wondering whether you'll ever be able to trust him again.
Coop: Lizzie. That's enough. Get out.
Lizzie: I was just trying to be honest.
Ava: For a change. She thinks you're going to be the father to her child.
Coop: Why would I want to be a father to a child that's not even mine?
Lizzie: It's true. I can see it in your eyes.
Coop: Lizzie, what you see is me being done with you. I'm done.
Lizzie: Okay, fine, I'll go. But I know that I'm right, Coop. I know you still love this baby.
Ava: You okay?
Coop: Fine. You?
Ava: Well, I'm not so sure. I find myself in the awkward position of actually agreeing with Lizzie for a change.
Coop: About what?
Ava: How could you not have feelings for this baby? I mean, you're only human.
Coop: Ava, how could I have feelings for a kid that's not even mine to begin with?

Ava: Because that's the kind of guy you are, Coop. And you didn't bring it up to me. I don't know, maybe you thought I would be upset, I wouldn't understand. But the reality of the situation is, you know, if you lie and you underestimate me, we're not going to be having a healthy relationship here.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan-Michael: Hey. Call in sick.
Marina: I can't. You know my devotion to duty runs in the family.
Alan-Michael: Right. Well, give me a call when your shift is done. Or just come back. I'll be here. Okay?
Marina: Okay.
Dinah: Hey, Marina, you're still here.
Marina: Hi.
Dinah: Hey, listen, uh... can I meet you in a little bit?
Mallet: Yeah, sure. Don't dally.
Dinah: I won't. Hi, um, listen, I want to apologize to you. I, um... I'm sorry that I blew off your idea about Alan-Michael this morning.
Marina: Oh, no. No, Dinah, really, you were right.

Dinah: No, you know, I think it's actually a good idea that you reel this guy in. I think that's one of the only ways you're going to get close to him and see what's happening, and, like you said, you're a cop, and you're going to keep your feelings out of the mix, and um... you know, if you have to play footsie with him a little bit, I don't think that's so bad. I'm sure you can handle it. It's not like you're going to be sleeping with him.
Marina: No. God, no.
Dinah: Yeah. So tomorrow you can give me a call, and we will find a way to get you closer to him and in his orbit. And he won't know what hit him.
Marina: Sounds good.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Gus: All right, uh... everything's in the truck. And I'll just, what, I'll take it to the shelter?
Buzz: No, I'll take care of it later.
Gus: No, I don't mind, honestly.
Buzz: I'm sure you have better things to do.

Gus: No, actually, I have nothing to do. I don't even have a job, so I don't have any money, so I'm not going to go buy anything that's not good for me like booze or... I can't even take caffeine. But I could go home and watch TV and I could remind myself how miserable my life is. I could do that.
Buzz: How about some decaf?
Gus: I thought you were mad at me.
Buzz: I am.
Gus: I thought that you and Frank were trying to avoid me.

Buzz: We have been. Look, I'm crazy about you, you know? But I love my daughter. And she had to take the kids-- my grandkids-- all the way around to the other side of the pond to avoid you. Now what am I supposed to do?
Gus: How is she?
Buzz: More to the point, how are you?
Gus: I'm good. You know. I've got, uh, five days clean and sober, so... I mean, I know that's not a lot.
Buzz: That's fantastic! That is fantastic! God!
Gus: Yeah. Well, Dinah had a little chat with me, and it kind of pushed me over the hump. And so five days, five days... who are you calling?
Buzz: Harley. I need to tell her about this.
Gus: No. Not until I'm ready.
Buzz: Right.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Coop: I guess part of me still does care about this baby.
Ava: Why didn't you just tell me that?
Coop: I didn't think you'd understand. Ava, you're saying that it's okay if I'm a bit confused? Thank you.
Ava: We have to be up front and honest with each other. We've been through way too much for that.
Coop: You're right. You're so right.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: I'm not finished yet.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: ( Sighs )
Jonathan: No, no. No more talk about Lizzie and the baby. Or Tammy. Any other topic you want. Any topic.
Reva: Cancer's always good for a laugh. Hee hee hee. ( Laughs )
Jonathan: What if... what if you don't make it? You ever thought of that?
Reva: All the time.
Jonathan: Because you told me that if I came clean about this baby, you'd be there to help me with it. And if you die, then you can't be. And then I lose Tammy and I lose you, too.
Reva: Well. I'm scared, too. But you know what? I'm going to do my best to stick around because you need me just as much as that little girl needs you.
[NEXT_ON]
Josh: What's this? "Ten things I want to do before I die"?
Cassie: Josh and Reva are more in love with each other than they ever have been. Til death to them part.
Lizzie: Today is the first day of the rest of my life with the man that I love. Henry Cooper Bradshaw.
